subtitle.Text: Steve: Inside of this file folder you find the first combination code in the game, this code goes to dad’s locked filing cabinet
and it’s 0451 which is a bit of tradition slash in-joke amongst... I mean it’s not really an in-joke it’s just an internal reference amongst
this lineage of games that hark back to immersive sims that are kind of first person exploration games that started with Ultima Underworld and System Shock,
and 451 was the first key code in System Shock and then it was also the first key code in System Shock 2 and Deus Ex and BioShock
and most recently Dishonored and I’ve personally worked on a couple of games that had 0451 as the first code in them
and we were really adherent to the tenets of the interactive model and kind of the principles of design behind those games when we were designing how Gone Home works,
and so, to maintain that tradition, we also made it the first code in our game.
Karla: And you made it the tattoo on your arm.
Steve: I also got a tattoo of 0451 because it is sort of a symbol of this certain philosophy of game design that’s important to me and yeah,
this writing, breaking canon, is in Emily’s handwriting - Emily’s handwriting is technically only in the font that exists outside the game,
she doesn’t actually do the handwriting in any of the characters but, yeah I had her write 0451 in her very distinctive handwriting
and then I got a tattoo of it and figured I would use that source image as the image that you find on the inside of this folder here.
